attributes.action: Make NHS gender service waiting times easier for transgender people
attributes.background: I am asking to ease the long waiting times for gender services in the UK, by allowing trans people to begin reversible treatment before they are seen by a specialist. This would prevent them from struggling with crippling gender dysphoria while they are on the waiting list, which can be over a year.
attributes.additional_details:
Lots of trans patients suffer with gender dysphoria, which in turn causes depression and suicidal feelings. Not being able to begin treatment can have a severe impact on mental health.
Many trans people take hormone blockers. This is a drug which is completely safe, 100% reversible and prevents trans people from going through changes which don't match their gender identity. All I ask is that the use of hormone blockers in the waiting period is considered, so their general wellbeing is improved.

attributes.action: Issue every Police Constable in England & Wales with a TASER by 01/01/17.
attributes.background: Police resources are continually stretch and the number of front line uniformed Police Constables is reduced year on year, whilst the number of violent crimes and assaults on Police continues to rise.  TASER is a proven less than lethal option and should be issued to front line uniformed officers.

attributes.action: Stop the double taxation of fuel through Duty and VAT
attributes.background: Fuel is taxed using fuel duty and vat, which I consider to be an unfair double tax

attributes.action: Alter English National Curriculum to spread grammar evenly over the 4 Key Stages
attributes.background: Because standards of grammar dropped over recent years, educators are now expected to cover the majority of the curriculum for grammar over Key Sages 1 and 2 (ages 5-11).  This material should be spread over the 4 Key Stages.
attributes.additional_details: So much grammar is being shoe-horned into primary writing that the result is stressed educators, anxious children and unnatural writing.  Many parents themselves are unaware of what is expected of their children and are therefore unable to support them effectively.

attributes.action: Accept Functional Skills as an equivalent qualification for EYE's Level 3
attributes.background: I am very concerned about the negative impact of the Government’s decision that all Level 3 Early Years Educators must have at least a C grade in GCSE English and maths with no equitable alternative such as Functional Skills allowed.
attributes.additional_details: Your policy will mean there will be a significant shortfall in the number of Level 3 childcare practitioners, which threatens the quality of care that children will get in early years settings.

attributes.action: Don't cancel the British EU Referendum
attributes.background: In response to the petition "Cancel the planned referendum on Britain's continued membership of the EU" which is fundamentally an affront to the ability of the people to exercise their democratic will. Leave or Remain please show your support for a democratic process that enfranchises the people

attributes.action: Make it law that cyclists have to have insurance the same as car drivers
attributes.background: I believe that cyclists should have to have insurance and registration so they can be identified and held accountable for traffic offences and incidents that they are responsible for.
attributes.additional_details:
Cyclists use the roads exactly the same as car drivers who have to have a license, Car tax and insurance but cyclists have none.

I believe as a driver that cyclists should have to have insurance and a registration so they can be held accountable for breaking road traffic laws and incidents / accidents that they cause including what I think is the most common road traffic law that cyclists break which is not stopping at red traffic lights.

attributes.action: Amend Shortage Occupation rules blocking hiring of Specialist Chefs from abroad
attributes.background: Britain's Asian restaurant industry is in crisis due to a shortage of Chefs. Though Specialist Chefs are on government's immigration Shortage Occupation List it disqualifies establishments that do Take Away,  Delivery, Buffet Dining and Event Catering as NOT having sufficient specialist skill needs
attributes.additional_details: THE INDUSTRY DEMANDS IMMEDIATE REDRESS AGAINST UNFAIR RULES blocking access to urgently needed Skilled Chefs. The vast majority of UK's estimated 10,000 Asian cuisine restaurants are experiencing staffing crisis with many successful businesses no longer able to operate. Many can meet official salary stipulation but are blocked by senseless ruling. The Asian restaurant sector is booming with increasing take away sales through online/smartphone ordering however government policy is stifling this
attributes.creator_name: Hans Raj Ram, CEO, Goldstar Chefs

attributes.action: Make glucose tablets available on NHS prescription for Diabetics
attributes.background: When a Diabetic has a low blood sugar level they need to consume glucose to stop the progression to unconsciousness and possibly death. Glucose powder is on prescription, but has to be mixed with a drink before use, which may not be possible in emergencies. Tablets are ready to use at once.
attributes.additional_details:
I have written to MPs who, after enquiring, have come back to me saying that glucose tablets cannot be prescribed at present. The cost soon mounts up, which for families on a low income could mean missing out on certain things in order to provide this life saving 'medicine' ‒ especially if there is more than 1 Diabetic in the family.

This all reminds me of a situation we had years ago when drug addicts were given syringes and needles on prescription BEFORE Diabetics were allowed to have them!

attributes.action: Extend Harvey's Mandate to include all of England's council roads.
attributes.background: March 2nd 2015, Westminster enforced Harvey's Mandate. This ensured that any Dog or Cat killed on England's highways will be scanned for a micro chip, a detailed log report created, photographs taken and the animal kept in cold storage.  We now request that the Mandate covers all of England's roads.
attributes.additional_details: With the introduction of compulsory micro chipping it is unjust that authorities can then defend failing to scan any animal that has been killed on a Council road.  Each year 1,000's of pets are killed on England's Council roads and no effort is made to scan for a micro chip.  Owners are left searching for their pet not realising that it could, in fact, already have been sent to land fill or has been incinerated.  As recommended by John Hayes,  this Mandate should to cover all roads in England

attributes.action: Stop importing puppies under 6 months of age into the UK.
attributes.background:
Many thousands of puppies are imported at the moment. 
The majority are bred in terrible conditions in puppy farms.
The parents live a life of misery and abuse.
Thousands of dogs are being destroyed every year.
The murder of mans best friend must stop.
attributes.additional_details:
It's estimated 40,000 puppies come from Ireland alone each year.
Some puppy farms there have a thousand bitches !Kept in terrible conditions.
Other EU countries would have even worse conditions. 
The UK can stop this cruelty by banning the importing of puppies.
The general public buy puppies from online sellers. They want young baby pups.
These are often dealers,including pet shops, who buy puppies cheaply from abroad, Many of which are sick or even dying.
They often have physiological issues !

attributes.action: Make it an offence for cyclists not to use a cycle lane where one is  provided.
attributes.background: Make it an offence for cyclists not to use a cycle lane where one is  provided and therefore they should not use roadways or footpaths adjacent.

attributes.action: Auto British Citizenship for EU Citizens working here for more than 10 years.
attributes.background: Give automatic British Citizenship to EU Nationals living and working in the UK for more than 10 years that never committed a crime and never claimed benefits.
attributes.additional_details:
The current process to obtain British Citizenship is outdated, too expensive and does not reward law abiding EU citizens that have been working in the UK for a long time and contributing to the wealth and cultural richness of the UK. 

EU Citizens should not need to pay for ESOL Tests if they been living here for so long and have other UK qualifications at Level 2 or above. 

Work and tax records should be checked by simply asking the applicant to provide their National Insurance Number.

attributes.action: Political neutrality rules should apply to both TV & newspapers during elections
attributes.background: Whilst recognising the need for a pluralistic press the referendum campaign demonstrated media barons attempt to influence voting. We believe this to be wrong and that newspapers should adopt a neutral, balanced and fair position during campaigns as TV news is required to do

attributes.action: Add a "none of the above" option to all ballot papers.
attributes.background: Consent is central to the concept of democracy. But consent is only measurable if it is possible to withhold it. This is not possible in current elections as the only options available are abstaining and spoiling the ballot in protest - neither being an accurate measure of voter discontent.
attributes.additional_details:
The above introduction was based on the following page from 38degrees. This page provides more information and context as to the importance of a "none of the above option"

https://you.38degrees.org.uk/petitions/inclusion-of-an-official-none-of-the-above-option-for-all-uk-elections-2

attributes.action: Fund more beds in Northampton General to help reduce cancelled operations
attributes.background:
Northampton Hospital's Chief Executive Sonia Swart said 60 to 120 new beds are required to cope with daily pressures. She said: "Additional bed capacity would ensure patients operations weren't cancelled at the last minute." 
These beds are needed to ensure people get the right care.
attributes.additional_details: More beds at Northampton Hospital would 'save money' - http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-northamptonshire-35937990

attributes.action: Revise Sch. 3 of the Infrastructure bill to protect ownership of public land.
attributes.background: This schedule  is wrapped up in obfuscating languge that many MP's would not have understood. It is profoundly undemocratic in that local people  will have no say over the sale of public land. It overides existing laws designed to prevent this.The Government is overiding local people/democracy
attributes.additional_details: Every law designed to protect publicly owned land is to be overidden. The Government says this clause will only apply to surplus public land, but does not defines what surplus land is. The Government will have the final and only vote on any decision.

attributes.action: Scrap handwriting requirement for highest writing grade at primary school
attributes.background: Talented, creative writers in primary school are being denied the opportunity to be acknowledged as such by their handwriting. Their flair and ability to engage and entertain a reader is considered of less worth than their ability to join up their handwriting. Sign now to stop this travesty.
attributes.additional_details: Pupils cannot be graded as writing above the expected standard at 11 yrs old unless they meet handwriting requirements of 'producing legible joined handwriting' and 'maintaining legibility, fluency and speed in handwriting through choosing whether or not to join specific letters.' The handwriting requirement is being placed above all mention of creativity and it's only the highest grade that has this handwriting veto. There are similar handwriting restrictions for talented writers at 7 as well.

attributes.action: Outlaw Opencast coal mining in the UK due to extreme environmental impacts.
attributes.background: Opencast coal mining in the UK is becoming even more popular. This way of mining has a detrimental impact on the environment and people. Opencast coal mining involves the extraction of coal via surface mining. Ecology of the area become effected, villages become effected by dust and noise.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.foe.co.uk/green-blog/can-you-imagine-what-its-like-live-next-opencast-coal-mine.
Opencast coal mining involves the extraction of earth and rocks from the surface of a mining area where the earth will be blasted apart to get to thin coal seems within. This effects landscape, people, wildlife, agricultural land, etc. Then, after the coal extraction there is a large risk that the mining area could be abandoned and not regenerated as companies promised before they begun extraction.

attributes.action: Make Boris Johnson apologise to the People of Egypt for his untrue comments.
attributes.background:
We, the British people that are living in or visiting Egypt on a regular basis request that Boris Johnson apologise for saying that there is a burgeoning crisis in Egypt, when it is not true. 
We are living and visiting the country happily and safely, please come and visit us and see for yourself.
attributes.additional_details: There are numerous British expats here in Egypt that can confirm that his comments are not true.

attributes.action: Reject any statutory instrument preventing McKenzie Friends charging a fee
attributes.background: In February 2016, the UK Judiciary quietly published a Consultation paper on reforming their approach to McKenzie Friends (MFs) who are (non-Solicitor/Barrister helpers). The Judiciary proposes preventing MFs from charging fees, regulating them, yet no have the right to 'represent' you for Court.
attributes.additional_details: The Presidents Guidance on McKenzie Friends 2010 gives the judges discretion to permit your MF to act for you and manage your case.  It is very rare to get permission. The Employment Tribunals Act 1998 s6 provides that a person may appear in person or else be represented at an employment tribunal by: (a) counsel/ solicitor, (b) a rep of a trade union or an employers’ association, or (c) any other person in whom the party desires to represent him. The same rights should apply in family courts.

attributes.action: Make Education Maintenance Allowance universal for all school pupils over 16
attributes.background: Educational Maintenance Allowance (EMA) is given to pupils who fall into the means tested limits set by government. This provides pupils with £60 biweekly. Universal payments would give all senior pupils a major incentive to fully participate in the education system.

attributes.action: Conviction of violence towards NHS staff hold a mandatory custodial sentence
attributes.background: Too many NHS staff are being assaulted whilst trying to help those in need and a mandatory custodial prison sentence needs to be in place for anyone convicted of it.

attributes.action: Link Local Housing Allowance rates to actual private rent prices.
attributes.background: People on lower incomes that have to rent suitable housing privately are finding substantial shortfalls between rents and LHA, even with the cheapest of houses. Council tenants in the same circumstances have all their rent paid. This is not fair.
attributes.additional_details: e.g.: A family of 4 in 3 bed ex Council terraced house, Chalvedon Estate, Pitsea, Basildon. An area classified as being an area of multiple deprivations by the ONS. Average rent £1000 pcm. LHA: £815 pcm. This means a shortfall of £285 pcm. A family of 4 in exactly the same house owned by the Council... no shortfall!

attributes.action: Create new Animal and Domestic Pet Protection legislation to imprison abusers
attributes.background: Britian is a nation of animal lovers, with an estimated 46% of households having a domestic pet. Unfortunately however, animal cruelty offences continue to occur, with very little in the way of "animal rights" to prevent them, or to punish offenders. Pets mean more than the "property" defined in law
attributes.additional_details:
Recently introduced legislation in the US will allow courts to treat those who abuse animals in the same vein as humans. Numerous physiological research conclude that one of the first steps towards a person being mentally capable of taking another human life often start off abusing and killing animals

At the moment pet homocide can only be treated as 'criminal damage', but with people like the Croydon cat killer freely walking the streets we believe stronger legislation should be introduced.

attributes.action: Make it unlawful for Police and Crime Commissioners to merely toe the Party Line
attributes.background: The role of Police and Crime Commissioner should be independent of Party Politics.  There is no place in Policing for Party Politics.  It should be made unlawful for PCCs to put Party Politics before the Public Interest.
attributes.additional_details: There are numerous examples of Party affiliated PCCs putting their Party before the Public Interest, this should be made unlawful.

attributes.action: Adding lessons about eating disorders to the PSHCE national curriculum
attributes.background: We believe that schools should include eating disorders to the national PHSCE curriculum because many adolescents do not understand the severity of eating disorders. For example some think that only teenage girls get eating disorders and if someone is skinny is means that they are anorexic.

attributes.action: Stop proposed loss of the Cotswolds within Gloucestershire to West Oxfordshire.
attributes.background: It is proposed that Cotswold District Council cease to administer The Cotswolds within Gloucestershire & that West Oxfordshire District Council take over that role. The 190,000 population have not been consulted. An ancient region would be lost to contrived unitary administration.
attributes.additional_details:
The Cotswold Disrtict area within Gloucestershire should not be allowed to pass into the hands of West Oxfordshire. The leader of Gloucestershire County Council has said it will "rip up" the county. Numerous bodies within the County have also expressed their concerns that this proposal would be detrimental, including the Crime Commissioner & the Chief Executive of Gloucestershire Hospitals.
This proposal is a threat to regional stability, pride & history.

attributes.action: Cuts to Local Authority Housing Budgets must be stopped, reviewed and increased.
attributes.background: More and more people are living in poor quality social housing. I visited a family recently who were given a 3 bedroom flat to live in temporarily until a permanent home was found for them. I have photos of the appalling condition of this property in Rochdale. This is happening across the UK.
attributes.additional_details: The property let to the family I visited was filthy, I have photos to prove this, there was no wallpaper on the hall and stairs leading up to the flat. Instead it had graffiti on the walls, plaster that looked liked it had been put on with someones fingers, holes in the walls, mould on the floors and walls, dirt inside kitchen cupboards. Surely properties should be in a better state than this? More money needs to be given for local authorities to give homes to people in a fit state.

attributes.action: Abolish the House of Lords
attributes.background: No-one in the House of Lords is elected. The House of Lords should be abolished, and either replaced with a democratically elected equivalent, or not replaced at all.

attributes.action: Call for an independent review into political bias within the BBC.
attributes.background: During recent weeks the BBC has been showing bias towards the Conservative party. On numerous occasions the BBC has failed to report fairly on industrial action in the public sector. The latest example is the non reporting of the Conservative party breaking rules on election funding

attributes.action: Take fluffy bedding for hamsters off the shelves! It's dangerous!
attributes.background: In January 2016, I bought my first hamster & I now have 6! During this short time of owning hamsters I have observed posts on hamster forums  regarding the dangers of fluffy bedding. This bedding can cause serious injury & even fatality to a hamster as a direct consequence of using it.
attributes.additional_details:
Respiratory issues - If this bedding enters the hamsters lungs it can cause infection. In many cases this isn't curable & will lead to death. 

Blockages - If the hamster was to consume the bedding, and it is very possible, it can not be digested. This will lead to blockages within the hamsters system that can not be dislodge.

Limbs - The most common cause of injury regarding fluffy bedding is limb trapping. The bedding can trap the limbs within its fine strands resulting in amputation.

attributes.action: We call upon the Secretary of State for Health to define "A Seven Day NHS"
attributes.background: In addition,to state whether it is Minister's intentions to increase the work force by the 20-40% necessary to achieve a "A Seven Day NHS",the size of increase depending on the definition offered. Or to simply shift staff from one time frame to another, thereby degrading the whole service?
attributes.additional_details:
For many months now, various senior government members have trotted out the phrase "A Seven Day NHS" without defining their intentions. Do they mean emergency cover at all times? Do they mean enhancing the current emergency cover by increasing diagnostic and other services out of hours? Or do they mean elective services seven days a week?
Each model implies a very different requirement for staffing, and associated funding. 
We call upon the Minister to set out this Governments plans in detail.

attributes.action: Take policy action to bring down and stabilise house prices
attributes.background: Since 2000, UK house prices have increased by over 140%, far outstripping wages and inflation. The average new home-owner is now 35. We call on the government to adopt the following policies designed to bring down housing market prices and stabilise them at an affordable level.
attributes.additional_details:
Previous governments have used policies designed to encourage rising prices to benefit existing owners, seriously hurting younger people.

This can be stopped and reversed by new policies such as:
-Restrictions on large scale and foreign investor landlords
-Protect remaining council houses and housing associations
-End low rates for buy-to-let
-Progressively tax multiple properties.

We call on the government to consider any and all of these options.

Homes are more important than investments.

attributes.action: Control the population of seabirds for health, safety and environmental reasons
attributes.background: The Scarborough News is campaigning for a change in the law to manage the populations of seabirds including kittiwakes in the interest of public safety, health and the environment.
attributes.additional_details: Lack of control over the seabird population has led to dangerous food-grabbing swoops on men, women and children, and the creation of a serious scale of mess and stench of droppings in shopping areas, and on pavements, shop buildings and the general environment.

attributes.action: Reduce waiting times for domestic abuse and sexual assault counselling services.
attributes.background: The waiting list for counselling services following sexual assault or abuse is usually around 4 months for an assessment alone. Rape Crisis centres are experiencing more and more requests for support. Nearly a million people are raped every year, but in the last few years have had their funding cut.
attributes.additional_details:
Sexual assault and abuse are often seen as taboo and not spoken about. Many survivors suffer in silence, unable to get the help they need to recover. These types of crimes have the lowest conviction rates making survivors unable to speak up.

In my own and friends' experiences, people with PTSD are often turned away from most mental health services, including the NHS. Most of the UK do not have access to a Rape Crisis centre. This needs to change.

http://rapecrisis.org.uk/statistics.php

attributes.action: Say No to an "Independence Day" Bank Holiday on 23rd June.
attributes.background:
Nigel Farage has called for the 23rd of June to be celebrated as the UK's "Independence Day", and that the date should be a Bank Holiday.

We the undersigned feel that Mr. Farage should not be rewarded in this fashion for his actions in the EU Referendum.
attributes.additional_details:
A Bank Holiday bearing Mr. Farage's name would be giving too much publicity to a man who has misled the electorate on multiple occasions, and who behaved despicably with regard to the "Breaking Point" poster.

This Bank Holiday would also be offensive to the 16.1m voters who voted to remain a part of the European Union, and who would not want be reminded of this fact every year.

attributes.action: Create a new bank holiday on 16 June 2016
attributes.background: We want Thursday 16th June to be a new bank holiday to allow people to watch the Euro 2016 England vs Wales and Ukraine vs Northern Ireland football games. This is the first time Wales and Northern Ireland have competed in the Euros and we do not want employees to be deprived of this privilege.
attributes.additional_details: We think this would be a positive movement in order to encourage the friendly and competitive nature of football. The European Championships only occur once every four years and employees will be denied of this privilege due to working circumstances. The England vs Wales game includes two of the UKs countries competing at 2.30pm, meaning employees will not be able to watch this. Additionally, the Northern Ireland vs Ukraine game is on at 5.00pm which further restricts employees.

attributes.action: Create a system for doctors to refer patients with two or more cancer symptom.
attributes.background: Mum presented many cancer symptoms over two years each treated individually, and the lump diagnosed as a cyst. She actually had advanced ovarian cancer. If she had been tested on symptoms being first presented she would have had a better chance of survival.
attributes.additional_details:
Professor Graham Neale found 15% misdiagnosed as minor ailments.
Early diagnosis of ovarian cancer has a survival rate of 90% rather than 5% for advanced stages of the disease and 70% compared to 14% in lung cancer. 
Diagnostic routes range between 12 and 38% of cancer cases diagnosed by Doctor referrals between 3% and 58% are diagnosed through hospital admissions. The majority presented at hospital and were far more advanced. One year survival rates were lower for those presenting at hospital.

attributes.action: Allow owner trained service dogs to be fully recognised and have access rights
attributes.background: Currently there is no official support or recognition for owner trained assistance dogs in the uk. As a result may cannot get the help they need from such animals. As charities have extremely long waiting lists or don't support a curtain disability.
attributes.additional_details: As a result companies like Service Dogs Europe took advantage of disabled people by offering what they thought were official service dogs to their disability and to multiple disabilities. By allowing people to owner train these companies wouldn't survive. To make sure that owner trained dogs are at ADI standards and that they help a disability it would be reasonable for the dog and owner to be assessed to minamise fake service animal. This would give many disabled people a more independant life.

attributes.action: Provide 15 hours free childcare for ages between 1year and 3 years old
attributes.background: 30 hours free childcare is provided for children from the ages of 3 but there is nothing in place between the ages of 1 and 3 years of age, limiting mothers returning to work and causing families to struggle with childcare costs.
attributes.additional_details: The government have increased childcare hours to 30 hours free after the age of 3. But there is still nothing in place for children aged between 1 year old and 3 years old. Nurseries are ridiculously expensive and women have a fight between returning to work and having their wages spent on childcare and having nothing left after or not returning to work and still struggling to get by with no income. It's just as hard on joint income families as it is on single parents. Providing 15 hours free childcare between these ages allows mothers to return to work after maternity without the worry of extortionate childcare costs but also provides essential and vital development for children of these ages.

attributes.action: Introduce 'Gender Neutral' public toilets across the UK.
attributes.background:
The UK should scrap gender segregated public toilets by replacing them as gender neutral. 
Allowing people of any gender or gender identity to use the facility without the feeling of any fear, harassment, judgement, discrimination or abuse.
attributes.additional_details:
As part of the LGBT community myself, I find going to a gendered public toilet a scary experience and I'm sure I'm not alone.

I have experienced harassment in both male and female toilets and find its becoming more frequent. I believe myself and others should be able to do their business in peace without being questioned.
I feel 'neutralising' the gendered signage of all public toilets would provide a more comfortable and safer environment.

attributes.action: Introduce tighter control of wild boar in the Forest of Dean
attributes.background: There is a lot of debate in the Forest of Dean with regards to wild boar which roam freely in the Forest and how they impact on our lives. Some people love them and some people don't. It is becoming more apparent the boar are causing a nuisance and are not just living deep in the Forest.
attributes.additional_details: Do we want tighter controls?

attributes.action: Allow commuters to claim income tax relief on the cost of travelling to work.
attributes.background: Commuters spend their own money to travel to work. Fuel & public transport costs rise and it costs more per year to get to work. House prices force people out of areas & make more expensive commutes. Where workers live & where companies are located could be positively influenced by such a move.
attributes.additional_details:
If all workers had the opportunity to claim tax relief on their annual commute this would ease the housing market, create job mobility and employment in more regions. 
An annual railcard from Worcester to Paddington costs £10,000. If a 40% tax payer could claim income tax back against this, it would have an effective cost of about £6500. It is unfair, unreasonable & damaging to the mindset of all employees that they are taxed to go to work.It is an unfair burden on hard working people.

attributes.action: Reconsider increasing Asylum and immigration court fees
attributes.background: The government intends to increase the fees required to for asylum proceedings increasing the burden on some of the most vulnerable people in the world to meet a shortfall created by inadequately funding the justice system.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2016/apr/21/asylum-and-immigration-court-fees-set-to-rise-by-over-500

attributes.action: Patrons & trustees of charities are automatically disqualified from being an MP
attributes.background: Many MP's voted in favour of benefit cuts & are also associated with charities for those directly affected proving a LACK OF SUPPORT and a CONFLICT OF INTEREST. To avoid this MP's should resign their position within charities immediately & should NOT be allowed association with charities in any role

attributes.action: Reverse the decision that four year olds should be tested.
attributes.background:
Children as young as four are being tested during the first days of early years education. 

Teachers and experts alike agree that any testing would provide unreliable results and be detrimental to the settling in period for the children to the new school environment.

attributes.action: Balance bike lessons on the National Curriculum for all Early Years children.
attributes.background: If you love seeing children cycling, and want every child in the UK to ride a bike before they are six, then please sign this petition and help The Bicycle Society achieve their mission: cycling to become a compulsory part of the National Curriculum for Nursery, Reception and Year One children.
attributes.additional_details:
Balance bikes are light with no pedals or stabilisers. With proven teaching methods, children will learn to balance and pedal competently, confidently and consistently. Highly engaging teaching and enjoyable games pin positive emotions to cycling, moulding our cyclists of the future.

Benefits:

-Increased cycle safety/Bikeability.

-Contribution to sustainable transport.

-Improved long-term health.

-Healthier communities.

-Reduced cost to NHS.

-Sport legacy.

Every child deserves to cycle.

attributes.action: Provide increased educational support to refugee children in Calais.
attributes.background: The vast majority of refugee children have no access to education whilst waiting for refuge, meaning their aspirations are cruelly taken away by the likes of poverty and violence. We must strive to make a difference to the lives of these children, who are innocent victims in a dreadful conflict.
attributes.additional_details: The story of a 13 year old refugee named Sajev, with dreams of attending Oxbridge inspired me to create this petition, I am a 15 year old girl who also has dreams of attending Oxbridge, and Sajev's story opened my eyes to how privileged I am to be able to go to school each day. We can and must make a difference to the lives of these children, who have had their education stolen from them by conflict and so I call upon my country to stand for these children, who are not so different from our own.

attributes.action: Remove rail franchise from Southeastern (Govia Ltd)
attributes.background: Southeastern provide a consistent poor service to their customers, causing genuine misery and despair to thousands of commuters in the South East. They put profit before customers and effect the daily lives of people who just want to get to work on time and in comfort. No more debating, take action!
